question: Okay, and what is the most difficult thing do you think about being a parent?
transcript: I think as soon as you become a parent you have to have a lot of responsibilities. like financially and you know, not only money stuff but also you need to guide them to the good way so that they can, they can become, your children could become good, good people and. Sorry, I forgot the question. Yeah, that is all right, sure.

anti_overrating.reason: 'guide them to the good way' (guide them on the right path / in the right direction).

question: What is the most difficult thing about being a parent?
transcript: And you probably would have less free time if you have your children because you need to play with them once you get home. So, I think, that is a really, that is a big part of, big part that you are like sacrificing.

question: What kind of public transportation do you usually take?
transcript: Oh, I do not usually use public transportation that much, but if I have to stay then it is probably the bus. I usually use the bus to travel to other cities of the country such as I do not meet my friends.

grammar.why_not_9: 'such as I do not meet my friends' - incoherent ending.

question: Which is one of the reasons why I live there so much.
transcript: It is pretty quiet. The drinks there are also good. I think my personal favorite is, milk tea with some coconut. Topping and some boba. I think I have this particular moment that I studied there with my friends. while we were studying some staff member I think accidentally dropped the cup they were about to wash it so it made pretty narrowly for in the cafe shop. after the incident, we helped him collecting some of the, shots from the cups that were broken and helping him beat the injury. I think he got a small cut. anyways, if I were to recommend a place to my friends for a location to study, I would definitely suggest them going there. Okay, thank you. Okay, since we talked about small business.

anti_overrating.reason: 'narrowly for in the cafe shop' (noisy in the cafe?). 'beat the injury' (treat the injury?). 'collecting some of the shots' (shards).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Has a wide enough vocabulary... but may make some errors.

question: How is important, I am sorry, how important is quality versus price when you make a purchase?
transcript: I think it mainly depends on the price itself. Sometimes the price can, if the price is high, then it is more likely for the quality to be good too. But it is not always the case. Sometimes the price also contains the brand value, which is maybe the quality of the item might not be that great, But the brand name cost of the, but the cost of the brand might make it more higher than the quality of the actual product.

question: My name is Druk and can you tell me a little bit about yourself?
transcript: My name is Trang Min and I am a student participating in this IELTS test.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: What is your daily routine?
transcript: My daily routine is quite minimal actually. It starts with me waking up and doing personal hygiene. Then I might or might not eat breakfast and spend most of my day at school. I spend some quality time with my family in the afternoon and do my homework for the rest of the evening. it is quite boring but it is the most efficient way for me to do it.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: So what parts of a day do you like most?
transcript: I would say it is the evening. it is strange because I just be studying like the rest of the day, but somehow it is different in the evening because the world feels like it is quiet for me and I can concentrate much better than the day. Okay, lovely. I will go to the last question.

grammar.why_not_9: 'I just be studying' (I am just studying / I just study). Informal/AAVE-like structure used in non-standard way?

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: What skills do you think are indeed to get a good job these days?
transcript: I think the first skill necessary in any kind of job would be the specialized skill. Because for example, if a person wants to become a musician, they need to be able to play some music and have fundamental knowledge about it. But aside from that, soft skills like teamwork and child management are also important and there are deciding factors whether you can work in a group or not.

vocabulary.why_not_9: 'child management' - maybe 'time management'? Or strictly about childcare? 'deciding factors' - excellent.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Uses a full range of structures naturally and appropriately.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: Do you think women should be able to do all the same jobs that men do?
transcript: The thoughts that women are inferior to men, I believe is quite outdated. Like, in the past, people used to think that only men can go to school and get a job and become successful, while women should just stay at home and become housewives. but, in the contemporary world, I do not think that is relevant anymore because you can see a lot of female leaders and politicians out there, so yeah, I think women are just as careful as men. Okay well then The last question How has technology changed the way we work Well I say that technology has quite an impact on our lives especially in work Because in the past we used to work manually and it cost a lot of human resource time and effort But nowadays we have automatic machines which pretty much does everything for us and we only have to like program and manage the system So yeah it makes our work process a lot quicker and easier Okay, yeah. So I see that you are doing pretty well for the IELTS speaking test.

vocabulary.why_not_9: 'careful as men' (capable as men?). 'inferior to', 'outdated' - excellent.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: So can you share with us some tips that you learned speaking in IELTS?
transcript: With regards to speaking, my first tip would be do not stick to the script. Because many people think that taking detailed notes might help you speak more fluently. But in reality, it is just going to limit you to everything that you have written and make you sound unnatural. And my second advice would be do not try to remember everything because well we will not be able to to be honest. So instead of trying to say things words by words it'd be more efficient to divide your speech into different parts and just move from one part to another.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Uses a full range of structures naturally and appropriately.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses language with natural and sophisticated control of lexical features.
